qa_summary.question: According to the hospitalization records of Upton General Hospital, summarize the present illness of K. Moore.
qa_summary.answer: K. Moore's present illness started suddenly 2 weeks ago at home with no obvious prodrome and an unknown possible trigger. The main symptoms include red, itchy skin rashes on wrists, forearms, and neck, with papules and occasional blisters. Symptoms worsen with scratching and slightly improve with topical creams. Accompanying symptoms include mild swelling and lichenification in areas of persistent scratching, with no fever or systemic symptoms. He applied over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream with partial relief and had no prior consultation before admission. His general condition includes a normal mental state, slightly disturbed sleep due to itching, normal appetite, no change in urination and defecation, and stable weight.

qa_summary.answer: K. Moore is generally healthy for his age with chronic hypertension managed with medication. He has had hypertension for 15 years, no history of diabetes or significant chronic illnesses, no history of significant infectious diseases, and is up-to-date with vaccinations including influenza and pneumonia. qa_summary.question: According to the hospitalization records of Upton General Hospital, summarize the physical examination findings of K. Moore.
qa_summary.answer: K. Moore's general condition includes a temperature of 36.6°C, pulse of 72 bpm, respiration of 16 breaths/min, and blood pressure of 130/80 mmHg. Systematic examination findings include erythematous rashes on wrists, forearms, and neck with papules, occasional blisters, and lichenification. Mucous membranes are normal with no lesions, and there is no significant lymphadenopathy. Head and organs are normocephalic and atraumatic with normal vision and hearing. The neck is supple with no thyroid enlargement. The chest has clear breath sounds with no wheezing or crackles, and normal heart sounds with no murmurs. The abdomen is soft and non-tender with no hepatosplenomegaly. The rectum and anus are normal with no masses or hemorrhoids. External genitalia are normal for age. The spine has no deformities or tenderness. Limbs show no clubbing or cyanosis with a normal range of motion. The nervous system is alert and oriented with normal reflexes and motor strength.
